Rearrange the following words to form a meaningful sentence:

toys of full The is bag
options: is full bag toys of The
The bag is full of toys
toys bag full The is of
full is The toys bag of
questions.answer: The bag is full of toys

questions.question:
Rearrange the following words to form a meaningful question:

book Henu is a reading?

Rearrange the following words to form a meaningful question:

the ships harbour in are the?
options: The ships are in the harbour?
Are in the harbour ships the?
Are the ships in the harbour?
questions.answer: Are the ships in the harbour?

questions.question:
Rearrange the following words to form a meaningful question:

for they party a going are?
options: Are they going for a party?
They are going for a party?
For a party they going are?
Going they for a party are?
questions.answer: Are they going for a party?

Change the sentence into a question:

The Earth is round.

Change the sentence into a question:

The ice cream is too cold to eat.
options: Is too cold to eat the ice cream?
Too cold is the ice cream to eat?
Is the ice cream too cold to eat?
The ice cream is too cold to eat is?
questions.answer: Is the ice cream too cold to eat?

questions.question:
Change the sentence into a question:

Grandfather is telling Raju a story.
options: Is Grandfather telling Raju a story?
Telling Raju a story is Grandfather?
Is a story Raju telling Grandfather?
Is telling Grandfather a story Raju?
questions.answer: Is Grandfather telling Raju a story?

questions.question:
Change the sentence into a question:

Betty is going to the mall in the evening.
options: Is Betty going to the mall in the evening?
Betty is going in the evening to the mall?
Going is Betty to the mall in the evening?
Is to the mall in the evening Betty going?
questions.answer: Is Betty going to the mall in the evening?

questions.question:
Change the sentence into a question:

Parul is crying because she hurt her hand.
options: Is Parul crying because she hurt her hand?
Is Parul hurt her hand because crying?
Because she hurt her hand Parul is crying?
Crying Parul is because she hurt her hand?
questions.answer: Is Parul crying because she hurt her hand?

questions.topic: Fill in the Blanks with Phrasal Verbs
questions.question: I love to ____________________ my cousin. She reads to me from my favourite books and plays with me.

questions.topic: Fill in the Blanks with Phrasal Verbs
questions.question: When mangoes are _______________, my mother makes delicious kheer with them.

questions.topic: Fill in the Blanks with Phrasal Verbs
questions.question: ___________________ now, if you want to be awake for the cartoon show in the evening.

questions.topic: Fill in the Blanks with Phrasal Verbs
questions.question: The cat ____________________ the milk I gave it.

questions.topic: Fill in the Blanks with Phrasal Verbs
questions.question: Sahil _____________________ to school after having his breakfast of cornflakes and milk.
The most important festival of Assam is the ________ festival of Bihu, which is celebrated _____________________ times in a year.
In winter, Bhogoli or Magh Bihu is celebrated in the month of _____________________.
Rongali or Bohag Bihu marks the beginning of the Assamese New Year during the season of _____________________ in April.
The festival is believed to protect growing crops. People usually light clay _____________________ in the fields to keep away the evil eye.
The traditional food prepared during all three Bihu's are delicious pithas, which are sweet pancakes made with _______________, the most important food crop grown in Assam.
Pithas are usually stuffed with jaggery and coconut or black sesame ________.
During Bihu, people gather in open fields and perform the Bihu dance, one of the most well-known ____________________ of northeast India.
The second cake that I baked was _________________ (sweet) than the first.
Priya wears the _______________ (bright) colours.
Rohan is __________________ (young) than his brother.
Meeta is ______________ (clever) than Dimple.
The cheetah is a _____________ (fast) animal than the elephant.
This is the __________________ (hard) question in the test.
That is the _______________ (ripe) mango in the box.
Last year, five year old Neetu _________________ (visit, simple past) her aunt who lived ______ (preposition) a village.
Last year, five year old Neetu visited her aunt who lived ______ (preposition) a village.
______________ (pronoun) had a lot of fun there.
She learned to swim ______ (preposition) the pond, and how to feed the cows _______________ (conjunction) buffaloes.
She learned to swim in the pond, and how to feed the cows _______________ (conjunction) buffaloes.
She _____________ (play, simple past) ________________ (preposition) the village children too.
She played ________________ (preposition) the village children too.
